cont.entity_a: Gateway to gateway VPNs drop regularly, requiring frequent reboots. VPN setup is easy, but some users experience connection issues. Issues with dropped VPN connections and MTU problems. Good for small businesses with a solid firewall and VPN features. Router works well for site-to-site VPN but not with VOIP systems. Router is reliable and easy to set up, with good firewall and VPN capabilities.
Dual WAN option works inconsistently, especially with unstable ISPs.
DHCP sometimes hangs and requires restarts.
Router performs well as a basic router and supports firmware upgrades.
cont.entity_b: Router is extremely stable with fantastic range. Router is fast, reliable, and easy to set up. Signal does not drop and provides consistent performance. Handles multiple devices and connections without slowing down.

cont.entity_a: Device gets hot, requiring installation in a well-ventilated area.
Easy to configure with a nice web interface, suitable for small installations.
cont.entity_b: Some setup features are more understandable compared to Linksys. Some users experience difficulty with setup and require advanced knowledge.

cont.entity_a: Load balancing does not work with most secure connections. Load balancing works well but is not smooth during transition.
Port forwarding issues, particularly with passive FTP mode.
Router has a robust set of features including Dyn DNS and VPN.
cont.entity_b: Supports stronger WiFi encryption for wireless access points. Router interface is user-friendly and supports packet prioritization. GameFuel feature supports VOIP nicely.

cont.entity_a: Router is reliable and easy to set up, with good firewall and VPN capabilities.
cont.entity_b: Device is reliable and works well with D-Link DWL-G550 wireless PCI Card.
Works well with X-Box Live and Nintendo Wi-Fi after firmware upgrade. Works well with a variety of devices including PS3, Xbox 360, and Netflix.
Wireless signal strength is strong and stable.
